snippet: Demonstrators in the Gaza Strip threw sticks and slippers at a vehicle carrying the United Nations Secretary General, Ban Ki-moon, on Thursday, accusing him of bias, witnesses said.
abstract: Convoy carrying United Nations Secretary General Ban Ki-moon is pelted with shoes and sticks by Palestinian protesters when it enters the Gaza Strip from Israel; about 100 men and women who said their family members were being held in Israeli prisons arrive in buses near a checkpoint in Gaza, blocking traffic and complaining that Ban, on his third visit there, had no plans to meet with them.

byline.contributor: Fares Akram reported from Gaza and Alan Cowell from London.

lead_paragraph: Demonstrators in the Gaza Strip threw sticks and slippers at a vehicle carrying the United Nations Secretary General, Ban Ki-moon, on Thursday, accusing him of bias, witnesses said.

headline.seo: Gaza Protesters Throw Shoes and Sticks at Ban Ki-moon
headline.main: Protesters in Gaza Throw Shoes and Sticks at U.N. Chief
headline.print_headline: Protesters in Gaza Throw Shoes and Sticks at U.N. Chief
